subject: p19075045
History: Status post CABG, chest tube removal.
Findings: The left-sided chest tube has been removed. No pneumothorax is visualized. Lung volumes are low and there is continued/increased infiltrate in the left upper lung. There continues to be retrocardiac opacity and a layering left effusion. Vascular plethora and patchy areas of alveolar edema are also seen on the right. The ET tube is 43 cm above the carina. The NG tube is in the stomach.
Impression: Markedly worsened appearance of the left upper lung.
